com.pks.names.extension.pojo
Class WordInName

java.lang.Object
  com.pks.names.extension.pojo.WordInName

public class WordInName
extends java.lang.Object

Word in name represents a single word within a name.

Encapsulating it makes it easier to manipulate in the context of a name This class implements the usual equals() and EqualsIgnoreCase that you would expect but also adds a extentOfMatch which handles initials (for people names), STEMS ( for organisation names), typos and similar sounding

Constructor Detail

WordInName

public WordInName(java.lang.String word,
                  boolean isPerson)
Constructor for a word in a name. It is mandatory to provide a word and indicate if this is a part of a persons name or an organisational or object name

Parameters:
word - The word that represents the name
isPerson - true if this is part of a person's name
Method Detail

setWord

public void setWord(java.lang.String word)
The name is set using the constructor but this setter allows the name to be changed

Parameters:
word - the name to set

public java.lang.String getWord()
this enables the word stored to be recalled

Returns:
the name returned as a STring

isIsPerson

public boolean isIsPerson()
This indicates if the name stored represents a real person

Returns:
true is a person, false if impersonal (it)

setIsPerson

public void setIsPerson(boolean isPerson)
Allows the nature of the word to be changed to or from personal

Parameters:
isPerson -

isLastWord

public boolean isLastWord()
By default words are not understood in isolation to be a first or last word but in the event of a personal name this can matter since early names may be replaced with initials.

Returns:
true if this is the last word

setIsLastWord

public void setIsLastWord(boolean isLastWord)
By default words are not understood in isolation to be a first or last word but in the event of a personal name this can matter since early names may be replaced with initials but not the last word.

Parameters:
isLastWord - set to true if this is the last word in a name

isFirstWord

public boolean isFirstWord()
By default words are not understood in isolation to be a first or last word but in the event of a personal name this can matter since early names may be replaced with initials and the first initial has particular importance since usually we need at least to names, the first and last and they must be in the right order and distinct.

Returns:
true if this is the first word

setIsFirstWord

public void setIsFirstWord(boolean isFirstWord)
By default words are not understood in isolation to be a first or last word but in the event of a personal name this can matter since early names may be replaced with initials and the first initial has particular importance since usually we need at least to names, the first and last and they must be in the right order and distinct.

Parameters:
isFirstWord - set to true if this is the first word

isInitial

public boolean isInitial()
return true if this is just a single character, i.e. an initial Note that to be an initial requires not only that it is one character but that it is a person

Returns:

isRealWord

public boolean isRealWord()
This is simply the inverse of if it is an initial. Note that to be an initial requires not only that it is one character but that it is a person

Returns:

extentOfMatch

public WordInName.MATCH_TYPE extentOfMatch(WordInName w)
ret = FULL, STEM, TYPO, PHONO, INITIAL, NONE

Parameters:
w - the word in name to be compared
Returns:
one of the enumeration WordInName.MATCHTYPE with options of FULL, STEM, TYPO, PHONO, INITIAL, NONE

Note that in this implementation the PHONO Match type is not implemented.
